name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: I will ALWAYS stand with women across the country in their fight for health care and reproductive rights.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: That's why I was proud to vote today for the Women’s Health Protection Act to codify the constitutional protections under Roe v. Wade and to ensure politicians never get in between a woman and her health care provider regarding her own personal health decisions. #WHPA

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Despite the Roe v. Wade decision nearly five decades ago that should ensure a woman’s access to the full range of health care options, including a safe and legal abortion, Republicans across the country are ramping up their all-out assault on women’s basic health freedoms.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: As a doctor, I strongly believe that a woman’s personal health care decisions should be made between her and her doctor, not outside politicians.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
Decades of U.S. global leadership in foreign assistance has proven that smart investments are critical to protecting the homeland. Our efforts have defended our nation and saved countless lives.

If we don’t keep one eye abroad, we unnecessarily leave our country at risk.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
Now, more than ever, the U.S. must continue to lead on #globalhealth. 

As Congress works towards additional funding and response efforts to fight this pandemic, it’s critical that our actions include funding to fight #COVID19 around the world. 🌎🌍🌏

#USGlobalResponse

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
Far too many nations suffer from weak health systems w/ unsafe water and inadequate sanitation tools, years of conflict, humanitarian disasters, and food shortages.

All these risk factors around the world only increase the likelihood of #COVID19 reemerging in the United States.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
Before #COVID19 hit, the @CDC warned that *70%* of countries worldwide were not prepared to prevent, detect, and respond to a public health emergency. ⚕️

Many nations just aren’t equipped to deal with the #coronavirus or any future pandemic.

#USGlobalResponse

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
No matter how successful we are in fighting #COVID19 at home, we will never defeat it unless other parts of the world are equipped to prevent outbreaks from occurring and can contain them when they do occur.

Left unaddressed globally, #COVID19 will find its way back to the U.S.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
The #COVID19 pandemic has reinforced this. Since originating in China in Dec. 2019, the virus has quickly spread to 170 countries with over 200,000 deaths worldwide.

The virus has hit the U.S. especially hard, with over 50,000 deaths and significant strain on our health systems.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
In our interconnected world, it can take only 36 hours for a virus to travel from a remote village to all six continents.

The sooner we act to contain a public health emergency abroad, the safer our citizens are back home.

#USGlobalResponse

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Our decades of leadership & investment in #globalhealth have not only saved the lives of people across the world, but have proved vital to protecting the health, security, and economic interests of Americans within our own borders. #USGlobalResponse

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Around the world, millions of people are healthier & more safe because of the efforts of the United States. Through smart & strategic investments in the @StateDept and @USAID, we have led the int'l fight against diseases like HIV/AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis. #USGlobalResponse

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Proud to join my colleague @RepTedYoho in leading a virtual Special Order to highlight the importance of U.S. global leadership in the fight against #COVID19. #USGlobalResponse

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
That's why I'm urging Congress to include my HERO Act in future #COVID19 legislation. 

My bill would provide critical mental health resources to ensure our first responders are able to cope with the added stresses of completing their jobs during the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/CfirtJaLhJ

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
This results in a difficult dilemma: our nation’s firefighters, law enforcement, and EMTs confront the most stressful situations when they are on shift, and when they are off, now worry about infecting/exposing their loved ones at home.

The mental burdens they carry are immense.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: First responders can’t choose who they are responding to, or know ahead of time if the individual is carrying #coronavirus or not, so they must now grapple with the constant potential exposure to the virus on a daily basis.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
But our first responders also contend with higher mental health stress and higher risk for suicide than other professions.

And the stress imposed by the #coronavirus pandemic is only increasing those burdens.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Just like our brave healthcare workers, our nation's first responders - our police, fire, and emergency medical personnel - are on the frontlines keeping our communities safe from #COVID19. https://t.co/rPK6SmW2LQ

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: While I did not come to Congress to impeach any president, I will uphold my constitutional duty to protect and defend the constitution of the United States.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: The President has abused the power of his office by withholding congressionally-approved military aid to Ukraine for his personal and political gain. The President then went to great lengths to obstruct Congress in its oversight of his actions.

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: After careful consideration and review of the facts, I have decided to vote yes on both articles of impeachment: abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

tweet_text: I’m pleased to share some of their stories here so you can see how we may be able to help you, too. 10/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: My office has now helped more than 10,000 people right here in Sacramento County – including nearly 2,500 veterans and servicemembers. 9/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: As a doctor who has helped care for veterans, I know how much our vets sacrifice for our country – it’s so important to support these heroes. 8/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text:
It turned out that while Sal was approved for his back pay, the VA had never actually sent his benefits. 

My office contacted the VA to expedite Sal’s benefits and the situation was resolved within a month. 7/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: As the bills mounted, Sal contacted my office to help with his VA disability claim – we got right to work. 6/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: During his second treatment period, the VA had not yet provided Sal with his back-pay benefits, adding to his stress. 5/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Unfortunately, Sal later received tests that his cancer had returned. It was a very stressful time for Sal and his finances. 4/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: He decided to use his Department of Veterans Affairs benefits to pay for his medicine and started responding positively to treatment. 3/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Sal was diagnosed with prostate cancer related to his exposure to Agent Orange. 2/

name: Ami Bera, M.D.
tweet_text: Meet Sal. Sal is a Carmichael native and an Army veteran who served during the Vietnam War. 1/ https://t.co/nbrG3cfAje
